segments.text: Good God.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Is it them?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I wonder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Freda is the only one who knows we are here.  She wouldn't ring up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It must be them then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It had to happen sooner or later.  What are we going to do?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [BREATHING]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We are okay, aren't we darling?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Now and always, sweet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't care then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It had to happen sooner or later.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hello?  Hello?  I'm sorry, what's that?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.  Wrong number. [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] That sent shivers up my spine.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What shall we do if they suddenly walk in on us.[LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: We'll behave exquisitely.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: With perfect poise.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I think I shall do a curtsy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's strange; things that ought to matter dreadfully, they just don't matter at all when one's happy.  Do they?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Hmm.  The pity is that one can't stay happy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Darling, don't say that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's true.  I think the whole thing's a cruel joke.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What?  This beautiful and sacred thing - love?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes.  Meaning just that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well what does it all mean?  That's what I ask myself in my quest for ultimate truth.  Dear God, what does it all mean?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't laugh at me.  I'm being serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh darling, you mustn't be serious.  It's just what they want.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Who's they?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: All of those futile moralists who make life unbearable.  You have to laugh at them, be flippant.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know, flippancy brings out the acid in their darned, light and sweetness.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: you know if I laugh at everything then I must laugh at us, too.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh of course.  We are figures of fun.  All right.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: How long with it last, this ludicrous overbearing love of ours?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Who knows?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shall we always want to bicker and fight?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh no.  That fire will fade along with our passion.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh dear, should we like that?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well it depends on how well we've played.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What happens if one of us dies?  Does the other one still laugh?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes.  Yes with all of his might.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well that's serious enough, isn't it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, no, no, no. no.  Death is a very laughable thing.  It's a cunning little mystery, it's all done with mirrors.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I think you are talking nonsense.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh.  So is everyone, in the long run.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Let's be superficial, and just pity those poor philosophers, huh?  Let's blow trumpets and squeakers and enjoy the party for as long as we can, you know, like small, idiotic school children.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh Come and kiss me darling before your body rots and worms pop out of your eye sockets.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh Elliott, worms don't pop.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh See, I don't care what you do, see.  You can paint yourself green and run naked through the Place Vendome and run off with all of the men of the world.  I shan't say a word, just as long as you love me best.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Aw.  Thank you, darling.  The same applies to you too, except that if you so much as look at another woman I'll kill you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Do you remember that awful scene we had in Venice?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Which particular one?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: The one where you put that tiny painted wooden snake in my bed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh Charles, that was his name.  He did wiggle so beautifully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [GARBAGE]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It was a terrible thing.  I hated it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know you did.  You threw him out the window into the Grand Canal.  I'll never forgive you for that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How long did that row last?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It went on intermittently for days.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Uh huh.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: But the worst one was in Cannes when your curling irons burnt a hole in my new dressing gown.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh And it burnt my comb, too, and all of those towels in the bathroom.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That was a rouser, wasn't it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] That was the first time you hit me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I did not hit you very hard.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: The manager came in, he found us rolling about the floor, biting and scratching like panthers. [LAUGHTER]  How utterly, utterly ridiculous.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] I'll never forget his face. [LAUGHTER]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] We were very much younger then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] And very much sillier.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: However I believe the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F
